item.description:
Based on the dictionary definition of altruism, Melissa and TJ will be discussing behaviors that are considered to be altruistic at individual and group levels (individuals might do volunteer work, governments redistribute wealth) and whether these acts meet the definition, which states that the act must not be in self interest. We'll discuss how seemingly altruistic behaviors could have developed out of individuals acting self interest and how myths about altruism are used in today's world to manipulate people.

Hopefully we'll spark discussions about whether common examples of altruism are cases of misguided self-interest, and how such misguided concepts are formed in the first place.

[On weekends cheap parking is available in the BU Babcock St lot.
Babcock St T stop on the Green (B) line is very close.]
